text.textblock: Description of Relief Sought/Disposition: To continue to permit the petitioner to conduct flight operations in support of research and development projects, subject to certain conditions and limitations.
Sections of the FAR Affected: 14 CFR 121.99 and 121.351.

To extend Exemption No. 3122 to allow the petitioner to continue to operate its turbojet airplanes in extended overwater operations with one high-frequency (HF) communications radio system and one long-range navigation system (LNRS).
Sections of the FAR Affected: 14 CFR 121.440(a).
To amend Exemption No. 3451 to allow the petitioner to utilize an alternate line check program permit in consort with its single visit training program (SVTP) for flight crew members.
Aerospace Industries Association of America, Inc.
To extend Exemption No. 4913 to continue to allow relief from the requirement to install the identification plate specified in the rule during the production phase on the exterior of the aircraft.

To extend Exemption No. 5439 to allow PHH corporation to continue to operate certain airplanes equipped with one long-range navigation system (LRNS) and one high-frequency (HF) communication system in extended overwater operations.
To allow foreign parachutists relief from the parachute equipment and packing requirements.

To allow the petitioner to establish an annual single-visit training program (SVTP) where Northwest Airlines, Inc. (NWA) would conduct a four-day, crew oriented, annual training and evaluation program for all pilots and to administer PIC line checks six months following the implementation of its SVTP for one complete cycle, thereafter on a random basis to 50 percent of its PIC's and all flight crew members.
To extend the compliance date for installation of airborne windshear detection systems beyond December 30, 1993.
To extend the compliance date for installation of airborne windshear detection systems beyond December 30, 1993, until January 2, 1994, for one DC-10 aircraft.
